title: 1000-3000 ping
body: For the past 2 days i've been getting some unbearable lag. My ping is usually 78-90ms but now its starting to reach 3000. I know this isn't my internet because i play whenever there's no one in the house. Can anyone help me/ know whats happening?{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

replies.body:
>  I know this isn't my internet because i play whenever there's no one in the house. C

That does not mean it is not your internet.

Where are you located, and have you tried doing a traceroute to the server?

If you are using Windows, open up the commandline (you can shift-rightclick desktop to see that as an option), rightclick in the console and paste in the following line (or type it in), then run it.

**tracert 104.160.131.3**

This will ping every address along the route to the chicago server and tell you the ping, letting you find the slow spot.

you can then google "Whois <slow address>" to see who owns it and report it to riot, they try to work this stuff out internally and with ISPs.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=YjemLlIr,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-27T02:19:48.927+0000)
